definition: from a particular thing or place or position (`forth' is obsolete), (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter

adverb
- from a particular thing or place or position (`forth' is obsolete)

= synonyms: forth
- from one's possession
= synonyms: out
- in reserve
= synonyms: aside
- out of the way (especially away from one's thoughts)
= synonyms: aside
- out of existence
= example: out of existence
- indicating continuing action
- in a different direction
= synonyms: aside
- in or into a proper place (especially for storage or safekeeping)
= example: in or into a proper place (especially for storage or safekeeping)
- at a distance in space or time
= example: at a distance in space or time
= synonyms: off
- so as to be removed or gotten rid of
= example: so as to be removed or gotten rid of
- freely or at will
= example: freely or at will
adjective
- (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter
= example: (of a baseball pitch) on the far side of home plate from the batter
= synonyms: outside
- used of an opponent's ground
= example: used of an opponent's ground
- not present
